Name: naveen k
Title: Live in a historic palace
Review: A historic palace converted to a hotel. They still have kept a significant part of the palace as it was in the bygone days. Excellent food and Sufi singers

Name: skychaserCalgary
Title: Beautiful
Review: We visited this lovely hotel and the grounds and topped off our visit with a tour of the place and then finishing off with High Tea which was excellent.

Name: Shikha132
Title: Live life king  size
Review: Falaknuma meansLikeHeaven .. and truly each moment spent here is Blissful.. the grandeur , the opulence the lavishness ofThe palace will stun you .. the palace has a lot of  European influence so you can see mesmerising paintings, decor,  fromThe windows to ceiling everything breathtaking . Thank you TAJ for the wonderful hospitality)( which make you feel like a nizam ) for  giving an Opportunity to experience this  wonder .. Thank you Abdul Sam for amazing culinary experience ! Our celebration was made special because of u. Heart felt thanks ! Hoping to relivingThis experience again soon .Fellow travellers each penny spent here is worth .

Name: DrQuresh M
Title: Very expensive - worth every Rupee; Superlative staff
Review: We were 5 couples all between 60-70 years . It rained throughout but the rooms were comfortable and the staff went out of their way to make us comfortable . It would be helpful if the lighting was improved in the outdoor areas and the lobby. Also a well defined walking track would be an asset as they own property of 300 acres but the staff were clueless about where I could take my morning walk for an hour!

Name: ljolsen12
Title: Wonderful place to visit!
Review: The royal arrival with carriage and roses was such a great experience. The tour was amazing. The tour guide did a great job of telling the story of the palace!

Name: Yukti
Title: A magical night
Review: Our experience was majestic - felt like royalty with the carriage ride and dinner then live music. Food was specific to our dietary needs. Plz take care of such historic properties for future generations to enjoy.

Name: anirban73
Title: A Royal experience
Review: Built in 1893, owned by Nizam of Hyderabad and now the Taj group, a heritage hotel. Ypou walk down history, with a royal treatmengt the moment you walk in. Located on a hillock, 2000 feet above sea level, you can have a grand view of Hyderabad. The staff are extremely courteous. One must book in advance, with 50% advance payment for dining. There are 2 main restaurants, Ada (Indian) and Celeste (Italian). A one hour tour of the palace is conducted by the staff of the hotel, explaining the history of the palace and all the rooms in the palace. No doubt the dinner is expensive (almost Rs 7000 per person including taxes for a 4 course menu), but its worth it, along with the tour that you get. Its a memory that you will cherish forever. The staff in Ada, where we had dinner was excellent, courteous and helpful. They go out of the way to make sure you are comfortable. Hats off to the Tata group for reviving this unused palace since 2010.

Name: Nikki
Title: Swimming pool and the gym
Review: Swimming pool and the gym and awesome dinner and breakfastThe trip was interesting and inspiringThe hotel is awesome than Wayne mansion

Name: Kellia H
Title: My favorite place to visit
Review: I come to the palace for dinner every time I come to Hyderabad. It is a must see. Always get the royal welcome and take the horse carriage up and get showered with rose petals as you ascend the stairs. Take private tour and dine over beautiful views of the city.

Name: anshu74
Title: Birthday party gone wrong
Review: Our experience at the restaurant we visited was absolutely something that came as somewhat of a shock to us...we were a group of 4 and had made an advance payment Rs.6000 per head for dinner.We ended up paying Rs.5200 per head because we complained about the food so were offered a 20% discount.To be fair ,the gentleman who was at the restaurant tried his best to salvage our meal...we were offered free mocktails(sugar laden coloured water) and free desserts...but the food was absolutely not TAJ standard or what we have come to expect of it.. food was tasteless..the vegetarians and the non vegetarians were equally disappointed...it was a forgettable evening...was there to celebrate a birthday but it will be a birthday we will remember for all the wrong reasons...there was no email ( we left our email id along with our comments  ) to explain this...not TAJ at all ...

Name: Anil S
Title: Family holiday
Review: Amazing hotel, palace restored to its full glory.Excellent service, staff treat the guests like royalty. Mr. Qayoom at reception, Mr. Nasir & Mr. Sudhakar at the restaurant looked after us really well. I would rate the service higher than any hotel I have ever stayed. Rooms are clean, spacious and very comfortable. Would highly recommend this hotel and would love come again.The pool also looked very nice though we did not get to use it.

Name: shekher Khandelwal
Title: THE DREAM VISIT
Review: The food and service was excellent and the total experience mesmerizes.  The Taj hospitality is par excellence. Well one has to shell out more to experience all this.

Name: Shagun S
Title: A really memorable day @ Taj Faluknuma - the High Tea was an experience par excellence
Review: The drive to this place was torturous  - we were staying near Tank bund in the city - but once we were on the property it was a magical experience!! An absolute must do in Hyderabad!

Name: Malcom J
Title: Hi tea
Review: The hi tea is incredible. There is a horse carriage to pick you followed by tour of the Palace and an unlimited fare of snacks with tea.

Name: Ramchandra Naik
Title: Family Visit to Celebrate a Function
Review: One of the finest palaces in India. The menu offering provides a very royal feeling. Food is great and the service is truly outstanding!!!

Name: Charles Dulles
Title: Royal experience
Review: We had the hi tea here. Transported to the days of Nizams! The spread was amazing and service was excellent. Expensive but worth it.

Name: Barbara A
Title: An exceptional place
Review: This has been my best hotel experience ever.  The staff is wonderful and would help in diet needs or anything needed in room or to make a comfortable. stay. The food was great and so was the spa

Name: Neeraja V
Title: “Scintillating View of the City”
Review: Enjoyed the most amazing view of Hyderabad from the ‘Jade Room’ with twinkling stars in the Sky touching the ground. Soulful music of live Sufi songs makes the place reminisce the days of Nizam. The historical tour of the palace is enlightening along with an sumptuous meal of  different courses.The staff are warm and helpful. The Grandeur and ambience of the palace is perfect for special occasions.

Name: Iain C
Title: Perfect
Review: If ever you get the chance to stay here do.  It is a wonderful hotel and not to be missed.  Everything is first class if not better and the staff and food are extraordinary.

Name: Swarnangsu
Title: One of the most exclusive Hotel/Restaurant in Hyderabad
Review: We went to Taj Faluknama for lunch + palace tour. You definitely get the royal treatment from horse carriage rides to floral showers to impressive cutlery. We had lunch at Adda which was a set menu buffet. The kebabs were simply out of the world. The rest of the spread was also good, but kebabs were the highlights according to me. Post lunch we took the palace tour which was good but I dare say falls a bit short if you compare with similar palace tours in Rajasthan.Overall definitely a very good experience. If you are going on your own, be prepared to shell out a sizeable amount. It is one of the most expensive place to go in Hyderabad. Also remember to book in advance

Name: PargaonkarP
Title: Good experience to have once.
Review: The palace tour is a good to do once. It is a beautiful palace. If you are lucky you might even get a glimpse of some movie shooting from distace. Food is definitely good. Chef took care of my request for pregnancy friendly food. The food did taste good. Will I pay Rs.5000 for the food there..... hmmm, I will explore Jewels of Nizam first and then decide. :)

Name: Ashwin Vemuri
Title: Tak Falaknuma Palace
Review: Ostentatiously Beautiful Palace Hotel, One of The Best In The World With All It's Princely Charm for Every Guest With An Amazing Bespoke Menu for The Upper Echelons.

Name: supermummy
Title: As excellent as we expected it to be
Review: From the warm welcome to the beautiful room and exquisite dining options this is a first rate hotel.  Perfect staff who are professional and friendly. Wholeheartedly recommend

Name: Wilayat
Title: Old luxurious walk
Review: Taj Falaknuma Palace is one of the most important places to visit in Hyderabad, it is not open for general public. If interested in visiting you can book a day tour, Nizam Palaces Tour by Telangana Tourism. This Palace was taken over by Taj Group

Name: ShankarTravelores
Title: The Royal Living & Dining
Review: Book for a dinner....months in advance.  It starts with a palace tour.  And choose the dining place as "Gol Bunglow".....ideal would be on the Diwali day.....with a pleasant evening weather....and Qawalli Singers on the go...takes you away out of this world.  You don't even feel that you are having a 5 or 7 course meal as it only melts the way the ears lilted with the music. And as you savour....just glance the dark sky that is fully lit up with the Diwali fire crackers colours.  Oooo.....what to say more.....you get to see a 120 degree view of the old city of the Nawabs.  It's a once in a life time experience for a common man like me....and a destination default for the who's who of the country.

Name: Res0rtSeeker
Title: Great Place
Review: Great place to spend the weekend. Interesting residence that is full of history. Just as some of the staff and they will tell you whatever you want to know about the house.

Name: Vagish Dixit
Title: A Palace which retains its aura
Review: Conceded that this is not a specially abled friendly place with no ramps and lifts in sight. But this is an old palace with the zillion steps from floor 0 to floor 1 and of course a horse carriage ride from main entrance to porch. Every room smells of history in its lush and princely aura. Service is genuinely reflective of the period and food is to die for. Overall this place is amazing and is a bucket list item for anyone visiting Hyderabad.

Name: Indusman248
Title: High Tea on Christmas Day with Spouse
Review: Great arrival experience on a Royal Horse Cart (Bagi) from the Palace entrance gate to the main porch - this was coupled with Rose petal shower as a romantic welcome to the Palace. The palace tour takes about an hour and our Tour Guide was using plenty of Urdu couplets during the tour which made the entire experience interesting. There is a souvenir shop in the palace which needs an improvement from collection and its pricing perspective (collection is not that great and pricing is on the higher side).Recommended not to take lunch before the High Tea as the choice is huge and one does not need to eat dinner post the High Tea. Price does not justify the overall experience - needs correction as found on the higher side.This Palace is being managed by Taj Hotels and it was found that it is difficult to get connected with the associates of the Palace for booking.

Name: Rahul G
Title: Unique experience
Review: I visited this palace with my team during my official tour. I must say it’s an unique 5 STAR heritage experience. Dinning is on premium side with 8~9K per person, but it all about experience.

Name: Avinash Reddy
Title: Amazing....!!
Review: Stunning historic Palace property. Parts of the palace are modeled on Windsor Castle and the billiards table is identical to the one at Buckingham palace. This was once the home of the richest man in the world. The hotel has retained all the original features of the palace. My only suggestion is that the Taj group address the issue of pigeons damaging the structure. Installing transparent fishing wire along the ledges is a simple trick that would stop the birds from landing.

Name: scvrose
Title: Nice building and views
Review: The Taj sits on top of a hill overlooking Hyderabad in the background on one side plus the old fort. There is an interesting collection of antiques from the previous owners.  Worth a visit.  Also had high tea in the restaurant.

Name: tapas1966205
Title: It's a travel to Nizami Era and back.
Review: It was off course a small trip. However, right from picking us from the main entrance in the Tah Group Buggy/Golf cart till the High Tea, it was amazing. It is worth to mention the palace guide with an excellent sense of Poetry ( shayeri) . Zade room was awesome, one will remember the bathtub fitted in the queen's ( Begum?) bathroom  and off course the 100 seater dining table. In fact description by words will be an injustice to the famed Falaknuma ( Like the Sky) Palace.

Name: blondeinbombay
Title: Dreamy Palatial Getaway
Review: We've been to the Falaknuma several times, for overnights and work events. The Falaknuma never fails to impress and inspire. It's such an escape from the city, the staff are always so thoughtful, the spa is fabulous, we adore the breakfasts, and have always really enjoyed the dinners as well.

Name: Eshita Shah
Title: Luxury at the best
Review: What a great palace turned into hotel. This place is so beautiful that you wouldn't want to leave. The hospitality is so great. A must visit property.

Name: Sanjay J
Title: Dinner at Taj Falaknuma
Review: One of the finest heritage properties - a must visit at Hyderabad. The hotel boasts of a rare library - an eclectic collection, care fully reserved and restored furniture, authentic heirlooms, fine photographs - overall an unmissable experience.

Name: Rohit K
Title: Dinner
Review: Memorable dinner, amazing service. This is one of the royal properties of Taj collection, must visit place in Hyderabad.

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: It's a great palace turned in 5 star hotel
Review: As soon as you enter the palace it will be a great royal treetment from the entrance. The interior is really beautiful. Especially the while climbing the Stair case you can see the history of the palace and Kings through wonderful arrangement of photographs. The rooms are superb wide. Facilities are awesome. In the evenings sitting in the balcony gives the most beautiful experience with your loved once.Overall its a Royal treat. The dining hall is also very huge with wide range of veg and non veg items. Overall its a Royal treat. You must experience once at least in your life time.

Name: amitthecreator
Title: Taj Falaknuma Palace
Review: Taj Falaknuma Palace, the former palace of the Nizam of Hyderabad is now a Taj heritage hotel. Set in the restored 1894 palace of the Nizam of Hyderabad, this opulent hotel is 2 km from Falaknuma train station and 4 km from the landmark 16th-century Charminar.

Name: Aatif Kakajiwalla
Title: A must visit.
Review: A magnificent palace. Extraordinary helpful staff. Superb comfortable rooms. Praises to Rishab and lakshay at the front office, prabitra the restaurant manager and all the waiter too. The housekeeping ask to be complimented for the prompt service.

Name: _karangehani
Title: A Must Stay Luxury Hotel
Review: Superb Service... Outstanding Food... Suites are spacious.. The Common areas are ultra-luxurious... worth every resource spent. The level of care and personalized service at Gol Bungalow and the quality of food is many notches above and beyond the normal. (one example...Had Biryanis at almost all Hyderabad well-known joints and then had one as part of the specially curated Telangana Food Thali for us... and we all just wondered what was the need to step out... this was the best.Front Staff.... young energetic well versed with going beyond the expected. Every minute...Taj truly is a different kind of magic.. and Falak Numa right up there with the best of the best.

Name: ravitaruna
Title: The RoyalTreasure of Hyderabad - Taj Falaknuma
Review: This is one of the most sought after place and has deep attraction among the visitors especially who are visiting Hyderabad for the first time and willing to live royal king size stay at hyderabad.Location  is strategically mapped to attract all type of tourists but preferably more worth in case you are on pure tourist visit and not on official visit to enjoy the place in totality.It has enchanting spell of the mirror of the skies, the iconic Taj Falaknuma Palace. It make you feel in diffrent world altogether due to it's ambiance and quality of services and for every thing including food & I will simply say  a world where dreams are fulfilled, right from the moment you descend from your horse-drawn carriage. This magnificent mansion conceived by the Nizam of Hyderabad. We can have  an authentic treatment at  Jiva Grande Spa,over all I suggest this to enjoy for short visit.However,charges for food and services are good but need to be improved and re-looked.there are so many other places as well whether good quality food are available at comparatively cheaper rates and having Hyderabady flavor.

Name: tschitra
Title: A trip down memory lane
Review: If you want a glimpse of what the Royal India was like before 100 years a visit to this place is highly recommended. The Taj group has done a great job of maintaining the palace and grounds in a very discreet manner. It’s all about the Nawabi splendour and lifestyle. The staff is very polite and knowledgeable. The walking tour is well done and flows well as one ascends the beautiful stairs up to the library, the queens quarters, the dining hall, the jade room and so on. The grounds have a magical look in the evening and the scents of jasmine combine to enthral you. After the tour you can carry on to the restaurant for your dinner. Again a sumptuous spread. Especially recommend the pan ice cream!Book in advance when you plan to go.

Name: Krishna Kanth P
Title: Royalty to the core
Review: Went for a dinner with business clients at The Falaknuma Palace. Everything here is just perfect - The horse carriage, The Flower Petal Welcome, The Guided Tour, The Food, The Ambience, The Service. We loved it.

Name: Emily M
Title: Fantastic and relaxing stay
Review: This place is incredible and I cannot recommend it highly enough.We came here on a family trip with my husband and myself, our two parents, and our cousin and her daughter. They went absolutely out of their way to accommodate our every wish. From special-order butter chicken at every meal and a child-sized bathrobe for my little cousin, to remembering just how my father-in-law takes his tea and what kind of roti he prefers, they really aim to please.The accommodations themselves are luxurious- our room was palatial and comfortable with fast wi fi. The courtyard is tranquil and inviting, and the incredible palace speaks for itself.The entertainment is superb, from the very talented live music offered daily both in the morning and evening, to the high tea program, to the lovely pool, to the billiards hall for a nightcap. One of the attendants in the billiards hall even took the time to try to teach us to play (we were hopeless!).The spa is lovely. My husband and I both agreed it was one of the best massages we’ve had.And the food! The breakfast spread has everything from South Indian staples to European Continental and everything in between. Dinner was scrumptious each evening, and the service absolutely could not be beat (special shout out to Hema Santosh, who took excellent care of us).In all, the hotel is an absolutely lovely and peaceful retreat, and you will feel and be treated as royalty during your stay. Don’t think twice and just treat yourself!

Name: rkapurs
Title: Relaxed break
Review: My wife and I stayed here for the second time and had a great time,  Right from airport pick up to check in was perfect. Our suite was just what we wanted.  The staff was brilliant. We took a spa and Rima and Pizzo were outstanding. I have had a lot of treatments at various hotels and Rima was simply one of the best. They were so good that we had to take a massage the next day also. We had dinner at Gol Bungalow. The ambience and the food was very good. The Hyderabad cuisine was authentic.  I wish they would take care of their service. The staff was courteous when they came to you. No one came and asked if we want a second drink. We had to signal a waiter. Our second drink came in 35 minutes. The assistant restaurant manager was helpful and gave great suggestions. We asked for food in 15 minutes but it came in 35 minutes. It did not matter as my wife and I were enjoying ourselves. No one to fill water glass. When the bottle finished no one came to refill. We got the dessert before the finger bowl. To top it all in the end the waiter came and said sorry for the delayed service as he was busy with the other table.  My wife and I had decided to have a good time so these points did not really dampen my evening, but come on is this The Falaknuma Palace we are talking about. Overall a great trip and would be back again but would never have dinner here.

Name: Shuddho G
Title: ..a world apart
Review: I had heard a lot about this experience but that was nothing compared to what you feel once you opt for this.Of course it is pricey but worth every penny.Must do if you can afford it.

Name: Garon_Susanne
Title: Sheer opulence and wonderful history
Review: A must if visiting Hyderabad. It’s an amazing insight into the life of the under touch of historic India. An amazing palace beautifully maintained. If you can afford it the lunch is worth doing, soaking up the amazing atmosphere and setting. If your budget is a little tighter then do the tour and high tea.

Name: futuregenie
Title: Well maintained, excellent service, superb staff overall a pleasant experience."
Review: A good place to visit. Very royal. The lunch prie fix is quite pricey(a good $1000 for 8 people), but a fun experience if you're up for it, it is a good. The tour is fun. Relaxing environment. A nice place to visit to understand the Hyderabad culture.

Name: Ekta R
Title: Excellent
Review: The whole experience was very good. The tour, the food, the ambiance and the people. It is costly but everybody should experience once.

Name: TheoP0001
Title: Magnificent
Review: This palace once belonged to the richest man on earth, and it shows. Splendor, wealth, grand scale. And the Taj people have done a spectacular job renovating it. Apparently, it took twice as long to restore it than it took originally to build it. Of course, you could stay in one of the splendid rooms but they are priced for their splendor. alternatively, you can book a dinner and get a complementary tour of the main parts of the palace and the gardens. Starry evenings give you a great view of the entire city of Hyderabad below your feet and out in the distance. The dinner is not cheap, but it will fill you with wonder (the tour and the place, if not the meal); it is worth it. And the staff is exceptionally well trained and very proud of the unique palace they have been entrusted to serve.

Name: Naveen
Title: Soak your skin into the grandeur and aesthetics as the Royal Luxury come alive at Falaknuma Palace
Review: Taj Falaknuma Palace needs no definition. In fact, it is beyond the scope of definition.  It is a true blue royal tryst with grandeur and aesthetics. I spent two days here and it was an experience of lifetime, always to be reme6and cherished for. The early morning breakfasts at Gol Bungalow which has a breathtaking view of the entire Falaknuma and old city area of Hyderabad is stunning. We enjoyed our delicious breakfasts here and I loved the typical Fakaknuma style mutton Kheema. We were treated with evening Palace tours which gives an insight into the royal legacy and history behind the rich heritage. The evening Qawali was soulful and the yummy evening desserts in our rooms were aamazing. I also took the Attar/Ittar Bath, which is an in room bath had the fragrances from the Nizam era with rose petals. It was indeed a great thing.The hotel staff was great in hospitality. We were treated with utmost care and every aspect of service was amazing.  The best part was the royal grand welcome as we arrived and were showered with rose petals. In all, one must definitely experience the grandness of this great luxury hotel. We went back home with treasured moments in our hearts and amazing souvenirs from the hotel.

Name: Kesslane
Title: Amazingly beautiful palace
Review: We were able to secure a tour with high tea here...so elegant and such a throwback to the 19th century.  Beautiful views and craftsmanship.

Name: Aditi A
Title: Superb!!
Review: The dinner experience in this place feels like a fairy tale! The atmosphere, the weather, the food, the music, everything was more than perfect! love the way they welcome with rose pettels . They surly make us feel special.

Name: krishna292
Title: Great Tourist Attraction with HighTea But at an Unreasonable Cost Not Worth
Review: During recent visit of my grandson, a student of Harward we planned to visit a different, out of blue place and chose Taj Falaknuma, a Heritage hotel of Hyderabad. The booking was done online and the package consisted of a guided tour of Palace with HighTea at about 3500/- rupees per head (nearly $60.00) excluding 18% taxes. There are number of tours at different times, High Tea, dinner, lunch etc and even the State tourism department also arranges these tours almost at the same charges only on weekdays but ours was a weekend tour. We were four people, took a cab that dropped us at the main gate from where battery operated vehicles take the visitors to the palace entrance. The main attraction is a bird'd view of Hyderabad as the palace is situated on a hillock. It has a well manicured garden and an imposing structure through stairs to reach the main lobby. On the way to palace we saw several peacocks and other structures, all white painted, probably rooms for the guests. The guided tour started at about 3 PM and our guide explained history of palace, background of paintings adoring the walls and roof, galleries, furniture etc, We were also taken to the main dining hall which accommodates 100 persons, one of the biggest halls in the world. The whole place looks beautiful but one shudders to think that all that opulence and expenditure was at the cost of poor people. Why the money was not used to eradicate poverty and hunger by these kings and nawabs. After an hour tour we went to the restaurant, known as Gol Bunglaw, There were several types of cakes, cookies, pastries, choices of soft and hot drinks and snacks, all served in a royal fashion with excellent service. My total bill came to be nearly 16000/-rupess, which is equivalent to about 250 dollars. It is not worth. If one has visited Salarjung Museum and Chowmoholla Palace, where all these items are dispalyed, one need not waste money here. I do not recommend this tour to Indian visitors unless they have money to waste. Of course foreign visitors, if they are staying in a hotel, minimum charges are 600 dollars per day, they can very well see the whole palace.

Name: franckbart
Title: An ok must do
Review: I went there for the very expensive high tea and the visit. Me and my friends could not understand a single word of the first supposedly english speaking guide we had. The second guide could speak a very good english but was a sort of a robot ! No passion at all. A real pity in such a historical property. The high tea is far too expensive for what it is.

Name: Maysadek
Title: Magical!
Review: The dinner experience in this place feels like a fairytale!The atmosphere, the weather, the food, the music, everything was more than perfect!

Name: NAZEER SHAIK
Title: Amazing experience
Review: No need to say special about it. Historical places always good to visit. Maintenance was good and nice look

Name: REENUJAIN
Title: Very beautiful palace.
Review: We stayed there so it was a very personal experience. We were treated like royalty. Amazing experience.

Name: Peter Rackauskas
Title: Birthday Lunch
Review: We stayed at the Taj Krishna Hotel and staff there organized lunch and transportation to the Taj Falaknuna Palace for my birthday. They also organized the amazing horse and coach ride to the palace reception area. Wow wow wow what an experience it was. The palace is amazing, being the home of Hyderabad Nizwan the history is truly remarkable and a must see. Lunch in the Indian restaurant was superb with gratitude to our waiters Santosh and Hema Santosh for their amazing efforts in making my birthday lunch and visit to the Palace so fantastic. If you visit Hyderabad visit the Falaknuma Palace you will be swept away. Truly!!

Name: velind7
Title: Live the Royal Life!!!
Review: The Grand Dining room is worth the visit.Note: Children are not allowed in Taj Falaknuma Palace Grand Dining Room.

Name: Srinivas T
Title: EXCELLENT PALACE
Review: It was nice 100 year old palace, has many surprises.  The old fans and bulbs still working in condition. Falaknuma Palace is well known for its architecture and for housing the largest Venetian chandeliers. Worlds largest dining table with the specialty of audio engineering ...etc. Must see and book for Evening Snacks or Lunch with tour.

Name: Amit C
Title: Spectacular amazing
Review: Breathtaking views, authentically restored, great history, good food.  Visiting this palace is a must if you come to Hyderabad!

Name: Srisadhana
Title: Royal experience
Review: Extra ordinary experience especially if you visit at evenings. Royalty is in every bit of the palace. But price is on higher side. Not a regular visit place.

Name: padmavathy66
Title: Not worth the Hype
Review: We went for evening High Tea.When we were ushered to the dining area I was for a shock.Such a tiny room and so much hype.our table was also very small .For 3 people they had to keep juggling the plates and the cake trays to accomodate all the items on the menu.Even the tour of the palace was  not satisfactory and lasted hardly 15 minutes as most of the area is used for commercial purpose .On that was there were few more private gatherings  so all that areas which are originally in the touring list were out of boundsWe paid a Bomb for this and came back with a let down feeling

Name: LordAdvisor
Title: Experience Royalty
Review: We visited the Taj Falaknuma in June 2019. The palace by today's standards may not seem grand and royal, however, if you take yourself back in time when it was built and look at it from that era, you may be able to appreciate its grandeur. The stories that the guide tells you about this Nizam and the making of the palace gives you an idea of the money that was splurged in making of the palace and the lifestyle that they lived at that point in time.We had dinner at Adaa restaurant and my experience here was not good. The level of service was way lower than what I am used to at Taj properties. It was definitely below standard.I would yet like to try out the restaurant once more as I believe in Taj quality of service and my this experience could have been a one-offI recommend Taj Falaknuma especially to foreign tourist visiting India.

Name: arunlahre
Title: Beautiful place to visit & exprience royal culture at palace.
Review: very luxury & rich experience really memorable fun & fill royal touch at every step. you can enjoy horse cart ride & night look of Hyderabad city from palace.

Name: RajeshKota
Title: Royalty to experience
Review: The palace was built by Nizams and is currently being maintained by the Taj group. The richeness of royal life can be experienced here with excellent ambience, food and cultural events. Prices are on the higher end though..

Name: Rana S
Title: Best hotel India have
Review: Elegant, Luxury and Mind blowing experience, Royal 7 star Hotel , I guess top 100 hotels in world, really worthful stay

Name: Daniel T
Title: Royalty !!!
Review: Royalty is the way to describe the experience of staying in this place. From the pick-up at the entrance, to the hotel room & dinning - everything is top class. Staff is super courteous.Very very expensive to stay here. Dinner itself costs Rs. 4000-5000.

Name: jainms
Title: Good and well maintained
Review: Good to visit once and one of the royal visit palace in Hyderabad, Lot of dinner and lunch parties happen here, its luxurious though.

Name: pjmkhan
Title: Food and Palace Tour
Review: The place is excellent. Ambience is fabulous. Food was delicious and mouthwatering. Palace tour was well organised.

Name: TravelbuggIndia
Title: Falaknuma Palace
Review: Must visit this place if you want to witness grandeur of past. I loved the intricate architecture of Palace.

Name: Srinivas G
Title: a day away from city life
Review: a great majestic palace with great ambience. the maintenance , and all arrangements like a tour of the palace etc were great. only felt the price was very high.

Name: Brock D
Title: Great tour and tea
Review: I am a bit of a history buff and so I really enjoyed the tour of the Palace and to hear about all the history. I enjoyed the tea with its combination of Indian and British fare.

Name: neha_traveldiary
Title: Royalty!
Review: It is a beautiful small palace nestled in the heart of old city reminding you of the bygone era of Nizams. However, the palace is now star hotel with a tour of the property along with meal. I would recommend a high-tea as you get you can experience the property n sample the food as well. Don’t go with expectations of forts n palaces in Rajasthan. Also, make 2 days prior reservation as they don’t entertain walk-In! Enjoy whispering across the 100 seater dining table 😊

Name: Bob A
Title: Our Third Visit
Review: Regret to say the standard of this hotel has slipped since the last two previous visits we rated 5 Star.The staff and opulence of this majestic palace have not changed (which is good) although the exterior of the palace is now looking tired and in need of renovation in many areas.Where we were let down was with the food and in particular the Indian restaurant that one night served totally unsatisfactory biriyani mutton - complete disappointment as it was dry lacked spices and was served with a peanut sauce!!! Really !!! Peanut sauce with biriyani rice - I don’t think soThe breakfast buffet was also ordinary and many dishes served luke warm - not good enough this time around

Name: Amit1965
Title: FALAKNUMA PALACE-Hyderabad
Review: This is an Awesome Heritage Palace of Nizam Era , its so Royal , Grand and Opulent . The Falaknuma word is FALAK-NUMA which comes from Urdu Language which means- " Like the Sky " or " Mirror of the Sky".This was the Royal residence of Nizam Mehboob Ali Khan Bahadur . Actually it was a Dream Palace of Nawab Vikar-ul- Umra around 130 years ago, it took 9 years to get it completed as it's foundation was laid in 1884 and it was completed in 1893, it is spread over 32 acres and is on a 2000ft high hill top from where you have a spectacular view of the city.It was taken over and opened by TAJ HOTELS & PALACES in Nov. 2010 as it was in poor condition in 1950's.Its architecture is very intriguing as its not Mughal or Islamic one but it is Italian and Tudor style as Nawab Vikar had travelled around many countries, he wanted it to be something exotic and exquisite.Its a MUST Visit on anyone's itinerary for Hyderabad.

Name: Srinivas Yalamarthy
Title: Absolute feeling of Grandeur... Truly Majestic
Review: Wow is the only word you will utter the moment you step in to the palace. Private vehicles are not allowed in to the palace and they will transport you on their buggy to the from the entrance to the main palace. They will only allow you provided you make prior reservation. Any amount of interiors in new hotels can compete with the luxury and decor of this palace. For a moment you would have a envy feeling that how grandly those nawabs would have lived in this palace. You get to see the Nawab's room and his attached bathroom with those vintage original fittings, which are nostalgic. The best part of the palace is the walk ways and the huge open air balcony with an amazing panaramic view is just stunning.. literally you can see the whole city as it is in a very elevated place. The food part is jus about to be ok nothing to rave about. The experience will be a life time. You must insist any of the staff to give a tour to the palace which was a great tourist  attraction long back with a dining table which can seat beyond 100 persons at a time. There is no end to explain the beauty and luxury of this place.. one has to visit to experience the same.

Name: VijayChandra
Title: Well maintained
Review: The beat of all is the lawn inside the Palace, it is magical and so peaceful, visited in the night for dinner, the food is very average, service was good, but the food taste was mediocre, not worth the INR 6500 per meal in the Italian restaurant

Name: Manjunath N
Title: Spectacular view
Review: Memories of old grandeur and regal traditions. Enjoyed a sumptuous dinner in the midst palatial luxury.  Once a lifetime experience.

Name: umapathi68
Title: Must see place in Hyderabad
Review: This palace is known for Nizam's era and their culture. One must visit this place if you been to Hyderabad

Name: Ajay v
Title: Stayed for a day in this Palace hotel
Review: Here you feel very Royal as you are pampered like a king .You will feel that you are king and this is your kingdom I loved their food and the ambience very much ..I will visit someday with family and stay here

Name: neeraj2013
Title: A top class Experience
Review: Visited with friends for High Tea and what an experience it was. A  detailed guided tour of the Palace lead us into realms of historically important riches in the age of Nizam of Hyderabad with fantastic interiors, the longest dining table, a well equipped library  and a breathtaking view  of Hyderabad from the stairs. Followed by High Tea with a splurge on variety of snacks t orelish. A must visit

Name: Sangeetha R
Title: Magnificent marvel
Review: Visiting and dining at Taj Falaknuma is indeed an unique experience.  The palace tour is exhilarating and out of the world experience.  Dining gives u spl feeling and royal. But the visits can be only few but can't be regular get away.

Name: reubenranjanfern2017
Title: One of the important points in this city.
Review: Beautiful design and architecture and very well maintained though. Really nice design. Would definitely recommend others to visit this place.

Name: seeker_here
Title: Height of Luxury
Review: The Taj Falaknuma Palace is the palace of he Nizam of Hyderabad and its stand true to its heritage. It is an amazing property, full of history. Staying here reminds you of the lives of the royalty. The views are incredible.

Name: Harsha V
Title: Royal Pampered Stay
Review: Everything said about Taj Falaknuma falls short as one has to experience the royality it offeres and the hospitality it demonstrates, staff loves doing what they do and becuase of that they go the extra mile to make your stay comfortable.

Name: Arthur Y
Title: Incredible venue, stunning views
Review: Highly recommend it for a high-end event.   Don’t forget to take a guided tour. The palace is stunning, it used to be the palace of the ruler of the region

Name: waheed khan
Title: Excellent place.
Review: A must visit place, one of the best  hotels in the world. A must visit tourist attraction. Nothing negative to present ,

Name: BhaskarVVB
Title: Elevated view of Hyderabad
Review: Went to Ada restaurant in TF a couple of times for dinner on both occasions. Food was great. Picked a set menu. Visit Needed a pre booking a few weeks ahead of time on both occasions. If you are a food connoisseur and hope to get a peek into the Nizam way of life, it is a worthwhile visit to attempt. Pretty expensive for a mere mortal like me. Both visits were business funded.

Name: Dilip kumar
Title: pleasant and memorial place
Review: This place has got its own importance and its been a honor to visit this place.Best historical place for hyderabad

Name: Alok B
Title: Should Not Be Called a 'Palace'
Review: The place itself is unbeatable and great but it is too pricey and dining here has a "MINIMUM SPENDING POLICY" which is rubbish in my opinion.

Name: Nishtha T
Title: Jasmine martini!!
Review: I had the pleasure of visiting Taj Falaknuma multiple times, with family, friends, and colleagues. This is a destination visit, if you know what I mean. From the moment we got down at the entrance, to the golf-buggy ride/walk upto the palace, and to the amazing tour of the palace, the grandeur and history, it was an amazing experience.We have eaten at the Celeste as well as Adaa restaurants, and both times the experience was sublime. Try the jasmini martini at Adaa (hope they still have it). Don't forget to take in the view from the terraces, as the princely city twinkles in the distance. All in all, an amazing once in a life time experience.

Name: Nid
Title: Beautiful palace
Review: This is a really beautiful palace with architecture and decor influences from all over the world! If you're not staying at the hotel, you can go for the high tea and guided tour. The high tea itself is not that great, it's tea that comes with a bunch of snacks but the palace is worth it.

Name: Bhaskaran S
Title: Good.Heritage.History.popular
Review: Great place to visitMajestic and happinessLongest dinning tableMenu in artistic wayExperience the Royal living

Name: erode m
Title: Dinner
Review: The visit is not just a culinary experience but also an insight into the way the I am so of Hyderabad. The dinner is preceded by a guided tour of the palace. The food is authentic Hyderabad. Italian and Mediterranean cuisine is also available. Reservation is a must and opens 15 days prior.

Name: yraghuram
Title: Lunch at Adaa
Review: The food was excellent and the hospitality of the restaurant staff is very good. I am planning to visit again at the earliest.

Name: Vishal G
Title: Dream place - once in a lifetime experience
Review: Great place to spend a day, you will enjoy the hospitality and see how life was enjoyed even 100 yrs ago

Name: Wankenne
Title: TAJ FALAKNUMA PALACE: NICE BIG CONSTRUCTION
Review: Hyderabad  is the capital of the Indian state of Telangana and de jure capital of Andhra Pradesh.Along the banks of the Musi River, it has a population of about 6.9 million and a metropolitan population of about 7.75 million, making it the fourth most populous city and sixth most populous urban agglomeration in India. Place to visit: the Charminar, the Golconda, the bazaars

Name: Ashish S
Title: Beautiful palace
Review: It was a Great place to visit. We liked the palace a lot. It is a very elegant place. This visit was memorable.
